    • Constructor Detail

      • Kusudama

        public Kusudama()

      • Kusudama

        public Kusudama(Bone forBone)
        Kusudamas are a sequential collection of reach cones, forming a path by their tangents.

        A reach cone is essentially a cone bounding the rotation of a ball-and-socket joint. A reach cone is defined as a vector pointing in the direction which the cone is opening, and a radius (in radians) representing how much the cone is opening up.

        You can think of a Kusudama (taken from the Japanese word for "ball with a bunch of cones sticking out of it") as a ball with with a bunch of reach-cones sticking out of it. Except that these reach cones are arranged sequentially, and a smooth path is automatically inferred leading from one cone to the next.
        Parameters:
        forBone - the bone this kusudama will be attached to.

    • Method Detail

      • createLimitConeForIndex

        public AbstractLimitCone createLimitConeForIndex(int insertAt,
                                                 Vec3f newPoint,
                                                 float radius)
        Specified by:
        createLimitConeForIndex in class AbstractKusudama

      • addLimitConeAtIndex

        public void addLimitConeAtIndex(int insertAt,
                                processing.core.PVector newPoint,
                                float radius)
        Adds a LimitCone to the Kusudama. LimitCones are reach cones which can be arranged sequentially. The Kusudama will infer a smooth path leading from one LimitCone to the next. Using a single LimitCone is functionally equivalent to a classic reachCone constraint.
        Parameters:
        insertAt - the intended index for this LimitCone in the sequence of LimitCones from which the Kusudama will infer a path. @see IK.AbstractKusudama.limitCones limitCones array.
        newPoint - where on the Kusudama to add the LimitCone (in Kusudama's local coordinate frame defined by its bone's majorRotationAxes))
        radius - the radius of the limitCone
